resource_dependency.serviceDataSchema: Database table 'services' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), description (text), price (decimal), duration_minutes (integer), created_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.bookingDataSchema: Database table 'bookings' with fields: id (UUID), service_id (foreign key to services.id), user_email (string), booking_date (date), status (enum: pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled), created_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.inquiryDataSchema: Database table 'inquiries' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), email (string), subject (string), message (text), created_at (timestamp)

function: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
static_description: The frontend application displays cleaning services, booking forms, and inquiry forms by fetching data from backend REST APIs. All content except static assets is dynamically loaded.

function: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: Backend server establishes connection to PostgreSQL database using provided environment variables for storing service listings, bookings, and inquiries.

resource_dependency.serviceDataSchema: Database table 'services' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), description (text), price (decimal), duration_minutes (integer), created_at (timestamp)

function: Service browsing functionality displaying available cleaning services
static_description: Grid-based layout showing all available cleaning services with name, brief description, and starting price. Background set to azure mist (#F0FFFF) and service cards use dark slate blue (#483D8B) headers.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking on a service card navigates to the detailed service page for that specific service.

resource_dependency.serviceDataSchema: Database table 'services' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), description (text), price (decimal), duration_minutes (integer), created_at (timestamp)

function: Detailed service pages showing descriptions, pricing, and duration
static_description: Individual service page displaying full description, exact pricing, duration in minutes, and booking options. Page uses azure mist background with dark slate blue headers and buttons.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Book Now' button opens the booking form modal pre-filled with selected service information.

resource_dependency.bookingDataSchema: Database table 'bookings' with fields: id (UUID), service_id (foreign key to services.id), user_email (string), booking_date (date), status (enum: pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled), created_at (timestamp)

function: Booking system allowing users to schedule cleaning services
static_description: Booking form with fields for user email, service selection dropdown, date picker with calendar icon, and submit button. Form styled with azure mist background and dark slate blue interactive elements.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the submit button validates inputs and sends booking data to backend API, then displays confirmation message.
Clicking the date picker opens a calendar widget for date selection.

resource_dependency.bookingDataSchema: Database table 'bookings' with fields: id (UUID), service_id (foreign key to services.id), user_email (string), booking_date (date), status (enum: pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled), created_at (timestamp)

function: User interface for checking the status of booked services
static_description: Status lookup section with input field for booking ID and 'Check Status' button. Results display booking details and current status in a clean card layout with azure mist background and dark slate blue accents.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Check Status' button fetches and displays the booking status and details from the backend API.

function: Contact page providing phone number and email address for customer service
static_description: Contact page with prominently displayed phone number and email address, each accompanied by respective icons. Background set to azure mist with dark slate blue text for contact information.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the phone number initiates a phone call (on mobile devices) or copies the number to clipboard.
Clicking the email address opens the default email client with a pre-filled recipient field.

resource_dependency.inquiryDataSchema: Database table 'inquiries' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), email (string), subject (string), message (text), created_at (timestamp)

function: Inquiry form for users to submit service-related questions
static_description: Contact form with fields for name, email, subject, and message textarea. Submit button styled with dark slate blue. Background set to azure mist.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the submit button validates form inputs and sends inquiry data to backend API, then displays success message.

function: Responsive website design with azure mist background color
static_description: Entire website features azure mist (#F0FFFF) background color across all pages and components. Layout adapts to different screen sizes maintaining consistent styling.

function: Dark slate blue color applied to interactive components and headers
static_description: All interactive elements including buttons, form inputs, navigation links, and page headers are styled with dark slate blue (#483D8B) color scheme.

resource_dependency.packageJsonStructure: { "scripts": { "install:all": "cd frontend && npm install && cd ../backend && npm install" } }

function: Package.json configured with `install:all` script for FE & BE dependencies
static_description: Root package.json file includes an install:all script that sequentially installs dependencies for both frontend and backend applications.

resource_dependency.packageJsonStructure: { "scripts": { "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"" } }

function: Package.json configured with `dev` script to start FE & BE concurrently
static_description: Root package.json file includes a dev script that uses concurrently to start both frontend and backend development servers simultaneously.

resource_dependency.postgresSchema: CREATE TABLE services (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), description TEXT, price DECIMAL(10,2), duration_minutes INTEGER, created_at TIMESTAMP); CREATE TABLE bookings (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, service_id UUID REFERENCES services(id), user_email VARCHAR(255), booking_date DATE, status VARCHAR(20) CHECK (status IN ('pending', 'confirmed', 'completed', 'cancelled')), created_at TIMESTAMP); CREATE TABLE inquiries (id UUID PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), email VARCHAR(255), subject VARCHAR(255), message TEXT, created_at TIMESTAMP);

function: Database schema supporting service listings, bookings, and inquiries
static_description: PostgreSQL database schema with three tables: services for cleaning service listings, bookings for user reservations, and inquiries for customer questions. Tables are properly linked with foreign keys and constraints.

resource_dependency.serviceDataSchema: Database table 'services' with fields: id (UUID), name (string), description (text), price (decimal), duration_minutes (integer), created_at (timestamp)
resource_dependency.bookingDataSchema: Database table 'bookings' with fields: id (UUID), service_id (foreign key to services.id), user_email (string), booking_date (date), status (enum: pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled), created_at (timestamp)

function: API endpoints for retrieving service data and submitting bookings
static_description: REST API endpoints including GET /api/services for retrieving all cleaning services and POST /api/bookings for submitting new booking requests with validation.

resource_dependency.bookingDataSchema: Database table 'bookings' with fields: id (UUID), service_id (foreign key to services.id), user_email (string), booking_date (date), status (enum: pending, confirmed, completed, cancelled), created_at (timestamp)

function: API endpoint for handling service status requests
static_description: REST API endpoint GET /api/bookings/{id} that returns the current status and details of a specific booking identified by its unique ID.
